inventory.commentary: Idioms are included; 'drop in the bucket' and 'drop of a hat'

sense.name: place to leave or pick up things
sense.examples: You can put these checks in the drop after hours at the bank. The police have located a major cocaine drop in the vicinity.

sense.name: a rapid descent, e.g., free fall
sense.examples: The vase didn't survive a second drop to the floor. His jaw dropped when he looked at the price tag. The paratroopers will make their drop onto the field at night. The drop in Pete's voice happened just this summer. (metaphoric)

sense.name: very small quantity of liquid
sense.examples: They placed a drop of blood on each slide. Water, water everywhere but not a drop to drink. Put two drops in each eye every night. This money is just a drop in the bucket. (Idiom; negligible amount)

sense.name: any object of a small spherical shape
sense.examples: Tiny drops of pearls hung from her ears. I have a delicious recipe for lemon drop cookies. Do you have any cough drops?

sense.name: a sudden or sharp decrease
sense.examples: There was a sharp drop in energy stocks today. The nurse carefully monitored the drop in his blood pressure. They are experiencing a drop in their standard of living.

sense.name: a steep cliff
sense.examples: You have to climb for a while and then there is a steep drop. The drop on the far side of the ravine was a sheer granite wall.

sense.name: a cloth used for stage scenery
sense.examples: Bill painted the drops for this production of Aida. Move the drop up a few inches because it's dragging on the floor.

sense.name: the hinged platform on a gallows
sense.examples: At the hanging they watched the drop swing away from beneath the convict.

sense.name: fruit that has fallen to the ground
sense.examples: This drop among the Zinfandel vines is intentional as it will make the remaining grapes develop more flavor. Birds and squirrels were eating the drop from my pear tree.

sense.name: having an advantage or superiority
sense.commentary: DROP[+state][+advantageous] usually an idiomatic form, 'a drop on'
sense.examples: This new technology gives the startup a drop on its competitors.

sense.name: very quickly, immediately
sense.examples: He'll come to our aid at the drop of a hat. You have to be able to switch gears at the drop of a hat.
